intro: Syngonanthus bianoensis, commonly known as the Biano's spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
